commitResults.messageTitle: added functionality of storing tasks and returning
added printLine method to replace repeated printing of breaking line
updated to properly use printLine method
added the ability to mark tasks as done and changing it back to undone
added support for tracking of three types of tasks: ToDos, Deadlines and Events
added error handling with custom exceptions as well as abstracted main logic to CommandProcessor class
added parseArgument method to parse arguments recieved from input
Move Task and its subclasses into 'tasks' package
Add retrieving of data from local storage
Update imports to match creation of tasks package
Replace import wildcards with specific imports
Add toSaveString method for saving task to local file
Add handling of CustomIOException from CommandProcessor.processInput(input, tasks)
Add catch clause for CorruptedSavedTasksException of addSavedTasksToTaskArray(FILE_PATH, tasks)
Fix minor details to adhere to code conventions
Update date-time fields to be LocalDateTime objects instead of Strings
Move Casper into casper package and renamed to CasperChat
Move CommandProcessor into casper package and renamed to Processor
Move PrintUtils to casper package and rename to Ui
Move FileUtils to casper package and rename to Storage
Move utils package into casper package
Move various components into components package
Remove parseArgument method that was moved to Parse class
Update style to comply with coding standard
Rename CasperChat.java to Casper.java and break methods into parts
Rename Ui to Stringifier and update methods to return string, not print
Update methods to return string rather than print
Update Gradle configuration for JavaFX dependencies
commitResults.messageBody:
The current Gradle configuration does not include the necessary
dependencies for JavaFX, and the main class entry point is incorrectly
specified. Assertions are also disabled.

Add JavaFX dependencies to the Gradle config file. Fix the main class
entry point to ensure the correct startup class is used. Enable
assertions to improve debugging and testing capabilities.

These changes are made to ensure the project can compile and run JavaFX
applications correctly, and to support better debugging practices
by enabling assertions.

No additional context is needed at this time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to file handling and task management methods
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation does not include assertions to verify file
existence and task management operations. Adding assertions will help
ensure that the program behaves as expected during debugging.

Update methods to include assertions:
- Verify file existence after loading saved tasks.
- Check file creation and existence after handling file not found exceptions.
- Confirm that the number of lines read from a file matches the list size.
- Ensure task list size changes as expected after adding or removing tasks.

These changes are made to enhance the reliability and debuggability of
the application by catching potential issues early during development.

No additional context is required for these assertions.
Add JavaFX Dependencies and Main Class Configuration; Enable Assertions for Improved Debugging

The current codebase lacks detailed Javadoc comments for several
methods, making it difficult to understand their purpose and usage.

Update multiple methods to include Javadoc comments. Describe method
parameters, return values, and any exceptions thrown. Provide clear
explanations of method functionality and usage.

These changes are made to improve code documentation and facilitate
better understanding and maintenance of the codebase.

No additional context is required at this time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' into branch-A-CodeQuality to pull updated Javadocs
Refactor Processor and abstract command handling
commitResults.messageBody:
The processInput method in the Processor class handles all command
logic within a single method, making it complex and difficult to
maintain. The code for each command type is mixed together, impacting
readability and testability.

Abstract command handling into dedicated methods: handleBye,
handleList, handleTaskModification, handleFind, and handleTaskCreation.
Update Javadoc to accurately reflect the exceptions thrown by each method.

These changes improve code readability and maintainability by
separating concerns. The refactored processInput method simplifies
the logic and centralizes command handling, facilitating future
modifications and extensions.

No additional context is needed at this time.
Improve Code Quality by Refactoring Large Methods and Removing Unused Methods

The current implementation lacks comparators for sorting tasks by
various criteria.

Add comparators to sort tasks alphabetically, by completion status,
by type, and by due/start dates. Include Javadoc comments to describe
the purpose and functionality of each comparator and their methods.

These changes are made to provide sorting functionality for different
task attributes.

No additional context is required at this time.

The codebase does not have a specific exception for invalid arguments
provided to commands, and it lacks a mechanism to suggest valid
arguments.

Add the `InvalidArgumentException` class to handle cases where an
invalid argument is given for a command. This exception includes a
message with the invalid argument, the command, and a list
of valid arguments as a suggested solution.

These changes are made to improve error handling by providing more
informative and actionable error messages related to invalid command
arguments.

No additional context is required at this time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add toSaveString method for tasklist serialization
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation lacks a method to convert the entire tasklist
into a string format suitable for saving.

Add the `toSaveString` method to generate a string representation of all
tasks in the list. Each task's representation is separated by a newline
to facilitate saving. The method returns the resulting string, ensuring
that the task list can be easily serialized for storage.

These changes are made to enable the serialization of tasks into a
format suitable for saving, improving the persistence of task data.

No additional context is required at this time.

The current implementation lacks a method to overwrite an entire task
file with new data.

Add the `replaceAllSavedTasks` method to replace all existing tasks in
the specified file with the provided new text. This method will
completely overwrite the file content with the new task data and handle
potential I/O errors by throwing a `CustomIOException`.

These changes are made to facilitate the updating of task files by
replacing their content with new data, ensuring the file accurately
reflects the current state of tasks.

No additional context is required at this time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for new "sort" command in Processor
commitResults.messageBody:
The current implementation lacks support for a new sorting command to
organize tasks based on various criteria.

Enhance the `processInput` method to include a case for the "sort"
command, which handles sorting tasks by method. Introduce the
`handleSort` method to validate arguments and sort tasks based on the
specified method (`alphabetical`, `type`, `time`, `status`). Ensure that
the sorted task list is saved to the storage.

These changes provide more flexible task sorting options and ensure that
tasks are sorted and saved correctly based on user input.

No additional context is required at this time.

The current implementation lacks a dedicated method for parsing and
separating sort command arguments into manageable parts.

Introduce the `parseSortArgument` method to split a sort command
argument into two components: the first three characters and the
remaining string. This method handles cases where the argument is
shorter than or equal to three characters by returning the entire
argument as the first part and leaving the second part empty.

This addition facilitates more effective parsing of sort command inputs
and improves argument handling in command processing.

No additional context is required at this time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add sort to list of valid commands
